issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Search and update existing copyrights. 

*Please add this DOC ticket number to all check-ins so we have a list of affected files - thanks!*

From: Beckham, Tony
Sent: Wednesday, January 13, 2016 1:15 PM
To: Hubenko, Alice; Cassler, Casey; Spencer, Harold Leon; Shaon, Imran Hossain; Bacchi, Matthew A.; Clark, Matthew; Holmstrom, Garrett
Subject: New year, new copyright dates 
 
Hi Team,

Passing this message along.

With the crossing into a new year, much like we need to remember to write 2016 on our checks we also need to remember to change our copyrights to 2016 as well.
 
When editing an existing file the copyright must be modified to include 2016 like so:
© Copyright 2015-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP
Or
© Copyright 2015,2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP
 
When creating a new file the copyright must specify 2016
© Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP
 
Reviewers, please make checking the copyright date(s) a part of your typical review process.
 
Additionally, please remember that our source files require copyright + license notification.   For additional details:  https://wiki.hpcloud.net/display/HHE/Helion+%28HOS%29+Copyright+Notice

-- 
Tony

comments.body:
Update all the ditamaps plus tools/DITA-OT/plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/xsl/dita/dita2webhelp.xsl 
documentation/content/en_us/ https://github.com/eucalyptus/documentation/tree/4ff4c325434ec4e2f0765f5e5df0174e2d9c0525/content/en_us

Since the wiki link is old HP wiki, copying the text here - 

Copyright Notice for HPE Helion Proprietary and Open Source  Files
The purpose of this wiki page is to describe the copyright notice/header that should be applied to all HOS HP proprietary source code.

Copyright Notice for HPE Helion Proprietary and Open Source  Files
The Copyright notice
File types to be considered for Copyright and License Notification
Where to put the Copyright Notice
When to modify the Copyright Notice
Example Copyrights
Example 1:  Software first published in 2016 with proprietary HPE license notification (for proprietary HPE files only)
Example 1a:  Software first published in 2016 with Apache license notification
Example 2:   Software published in 2014 and modified in 2015 and 2016 with proprietary HPE license notification (for proprietary HPE files only)
Example 2a:  Software published in 2015 and modified in 2016 with Apache license notification
References
Here is the new HPE copyright info .  That info should probably be incorporated into this wiki page.

The Copyright notice
The copyright notice is comprised of two parts

The copyright - indicates the date(s) and company that holds the copyright
The license notification  - indicates what license applies.  i.e.,, Apache GPL or proprietary
File types to be considered for Copyright and License Notification
In general, any file that HP would have a copyright interest in should have the copyright notice in it.  In most cases this would be source code files, but it also may be other file types.  The below list are several file types but should not be considered inclusive:

files that contain statements using a programming language file (python, java, c++, ansible, yaml, json, jinja2, etc.)
template files
config files .
html
any scripting language (i.e., javascript, bash, ksh, csh)
Examples
	J2 files
The .j2 files are source files that ultimately generate the upstream data and configuration files. It is desirable to have the copyright and license notification into the .j2 file but not in the resulting .ini or .conf file. To prevent the generation of the copyright and license notification in the generated files the { } syntax will suppress the output of the line.

This example is shown with the HPE proprietary license notification in a new file.

{ © Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP }
{ Confidential computer software. Valid license from HPE required for possession, use or copying. Consistent with FAR 12.211 and 12.212, Commercial Computer Software, Computer Software Documentation, and Technical Data for Commercial Items are licensed }
{ to the U.S. Government under vendor's standard commercial license. }
 
 

 What does not require a Copyright or License Notification

Any text or file that is written or created by a tool or process (i.e., the file can be regenerated at any time)
A binary file 
Compiled files should get the copyright via the source code during the compilation process
Where to put the Copyright Notice
The copyright notice should be included in those files where HP has a copyright interest (e.g., new files or where modifications are made).  In general, the guidance is that the copyright notice should be placed on the first line of all source files that are visible to the user (or above any other existing copyright notices).  Do not remove existing copyright notices The top of the file placement is preferable to ensure that users have a reasonable notice of the claim of the copyright.  This applies to all files that are laid down as part of the product install, regardless of their use.

Guidance:

If only minor changes are being made in the file, the HPE copyright  does not need to be modified or added.  If more invasive changes are being made the copyright should be modified or added.
The license notification should always be added to any source code file or other files as described above.  Only one license notification should be present in the file.  Openstack files use the Apache notification (see below)
For additional details reference the  HP Copyright Guide

When to modify the Copyright Notice
When do I...
 
Modify only the Copyright when these conditions are met	
The source code file contains an existing copyright and header AND modifications were made to the file. Update the copyright year(s) if the modification year is different that the currently stated copyright year and if the license header remains the same. See Example 2.
Add/Modify the Copyright and Header when these conditions are met	
New HP proprietary source code file. See Example 1.
HP proprietary source code file is being pushed upstream (replace HP proprietary license with the appropriate license (for OpenStack this will be the Apache header). See Example 3.
Not make any changes	
Source code file was not modified
Modification was made to the source code file in the same year as stated in the copyright
File is a generated file that can be recreated
File is a system (i.e., Linux) file
Example Copyrights
Example 1:  Software first published in 2016 with proprietary HPE license notification (for proprietary HPE files only)
© Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP 
 
Confidential computer software. Valid license from HPE required for possession, use or copying. Consistent with FAR 12.211 and 12.212, Commercial Computer Software, Computer Software Documentation, and Technical Data for Commercial Items are licensed to the U.S. Government under vendor's standard commercial license.
Example 1a:  Software first published in 2016 with Apache license notification
© Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP 
 
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may 
not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain 
a copy of the License at 
 
http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
 
Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software 
distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT 
WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the 
License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations 
under the License. 
Example 2:   Software published in 2014 and modified in 2015 and 2016 with proprietary HPE license notification (for proprietary HPE files only)
© Copyright 2014-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP  
 
Confidential computer software. Valid license from HPE required for possession, use or copying. Consistent with FAR 12.211 and 12.212, Commercial Computer Software, Computer Software Documentation, and Technical Data for Commercial Items are licensed to the U.S. Government under vendor's standard commercial license.
Example 2a:  Software published in 2015 and modified in 2016 with Apache license notification
© Copyright 2015-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP  
 
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may 
not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain 
a copy of the License at 
 
http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
 
Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software 
distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT 
WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the 
License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations 
under the License.

References
HP Copyright Guide
http://ent241.sharepoint.hp.com/teams/trademark/CopyrightGuide/Wiki%20Pages/Home.aspx
(also this is HP, not HPE, so will undoubtedly get updated)
Hi [~scottb] can you take a quick look to ensure I got it all? If not, please check in anything using this ticket. thanks, kjm
